locations.name: Cargo Hold
description: This space could contain just about anything, provided it can fit in through the cargo hatch.

locations.name: Crew Quarters
description: Ten hammocks are arrayed in this area, in two tiers. The crew members sleep here, usually in shifts. In addition there can usually be found a number of sea chests, one per crewman, arranged beneath the hammocks.

locations.name: Main Deck
description: The main deck is a broad, open space, although usually it is filled at least in part with ropes, the ship's anchor, a lifeboat and that sort of thing. In between the two masts is the hatch providing access to the cargo hold below.

locations.name: Private Cabin
description: For important passengers or, at least, those who can pay for it, this cabin boasts a bed and perhaps a table or a storage trunk. It can also be used for a first mate, if appropriate.

locations.name: Private Cabin
description: This cabin is laid out in the same manner as the other one, above.

locations.name: Captain's Cabin
description: By far the most elaborate quarters on the vessel is this small room. It has a table with four chairs for holding meetings, along with a bed, a wardrobe, a chest and a barrel of liquor.

locations.name: Sterncastle
description: The ship's wheel is located on this raised platform at the aft of the vessel; it is generally from here that the captain issues orders while sailing.
